result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew T. Ziebel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs including Department of Corrections supervision fees.  **NOTE:  THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.  Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
------------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before 10-27-2016 at 8:00 a.m.

Scheduling Order Copies provided to Counsel in Court on this date

Defendant Andrew T. Ziebel in court with attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec Iii.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on September 28, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Transcript of Motion Hearing before the Hon. David M. Reddy on January 27, 2016
Court Reporter:  Eileen Walsh Grzenia
In Court File

10:07 a.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Andrew T. Ziebel in court with attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec.  
Matter is before the Court on the Defendant's Motion to Suppress Fruits of Illegal Stop.   
10:08 a.m.  Sgt. Wilbert Kennedy is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Attorney Necci.  
Exhibit 1 marked and identified as photo of Nippersink Road
Exhibit 1 is offered and received
Exhibit 2 marked and identified as CD recording of squad video
Exhibit 2 is offered and received.  
10:24 a.m.  A portion of the video recording is played in Court.
10:27 a.m.  Court makes record with regard to "stop time" as the video.  
Attorney Necci indicates that the Video was played from "zero to 2 minutes and 40 seconds"
10:28 a.m.  Continued direct exam of Officer Kennedy by Attorney Necci.  
10:31 a.m.  Cross exam by Attorney Kmiec.  
10:39 a.m.  Attorney Kmiec replays a portion of the video recording from the squad - starting at 5 seconds into the video.  
10:39 a.m.  Continued cross of Sgt. Kennedy by Attorney Kmiec.  
10:41 a.m.  Attorney Kmiec plays another short portion of the video recording.
10:41 a.m.  Continued cross of Sgt Kennedy by Attorney Kmiec.  
10:45 a.m.  Redirect by Attorney Necci.  
10:47 a.m.  Recross by Attorney Kmiec.  
10:49 a.m.  Witness excused.  No other witnesses by either State of Defense.
10:50 a.m.  Argument by Attorney Necci.  
10:53 a.m.  Argument by Attorney Kmiec.  
10:57 a.m.  Court believes it comes down to credibility and the Court believes the Sgt's testimony was credible.  
Court makes record relying upon the testimony of Sgt Kennedy and finds that there was not sufficent natural light.
Court finds the stop was justified by a reason a suspicipion and vehicle was not property lit.  Court denies the Motion.  
Final pre-trial scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
11:01 a.m.  Court in recess
